newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian Duma to discuss budget fate on Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: Russian Duma to discuss budget fate on Wednesday.

text.p: The State Duma lower house of parliament decided on Friday to vote next week on the fate of the governent's rejected 1997 budget.
Deputies formed a working group which will recommend one of two alternatives for deputies to debate on Wednesday October 16. The group will meet on Monday.
One possibility is for the Duma to reject the government's draft altogether, and to order the government to produce a new budget within 20 days.
The alternative is to form a tripartite conciliation commission with representatives from the Duma, Federation Council upper house and government, to iron out the differences.
Earlier the Duma rejected the government's draft by 280 votes to 33.
The draft envisaged spending of 524.34 trillion roubles, revenues of 433.64 trillion and a deficit of 90.70 trillion, or 3.3 percent of GDP.
